original: BODMAN, Anders Gustaf (Gösta), Professor, Stockholm, f Råneå, Norrb, 5/8 75 av prov.läk G B o Anna Ekström, gm Elsa Bodman. Studex Upps 93, fil kand Upps 97, fil lic 01, fil dr 06. Meteorolog o magnetiker sv syd-polsexp 01—03. Lär Gbg h samsk 07—16, CTH fr 10, lekt H lär :nesem Sth 15, prof CTH i oorg kemi m miner o geol 16—40, föreläs söm-mark Upps o Gbg. Led o styr.ordf Gbg slöjdfrns sk, styr.led Gbg stadsbibl, ordf lokalstyr Gbg h a l f fi. Sekr Tekn samf i Gbg o Sällsk Gnistan Gbg. Av trycket: Gbg äldre ind (23), Fabr o ind i gamla Gbg (25), Gbg ind.hist i siffror 1747—1920 (26), Eneroth & Co o dess föregångare (30), Sockerbr i Gbg 1808—1934 (34), Carneg Porterbr 1812—1938 (38), Chalm Tekn Inst, Matrik 1829—1929 (29), redig Chalm Tekn Inst 1829—1929 (29), Tekn Samf i Gbg 1882—1932 (32), förf o utg en del Odd Fellow-litt (36), kem, meteor, petrogr o geol skr o upps. RNO, Odd Fellow, HedL Västml-Dal nät Upps o Chalm stud.k Gbg, idr.m g. Hobbies: Släktforsk, filateli.
translated: BODMAN, Anders Gustaf (Gösta), Professor, Stockholm, born in Råneå, Norrbotten, 8th May 1875, son of the provincial physician G B and Anna Ekström, married to Elsa Bodman. Studied at Uppsala University, received a Bachelor of Arts degree in 1897, a Licentiate in Philosophy in 1901, and a Doctorate in Philosophy in 1906. Meteorologist and magnetologist on the Swedish South Polar Expedition from 1901 to 1903. Taught at Gothenburg High School from 1907 to 1916, Chalmers University of Technology from 1910, lecturer at the Royal Institute of Technology from 1915, professor of inorganic chemistry with mineralogy and geology at Chalmers University from 1916 to 1940, gave lectures on soil fertility at Uppsala and Gothenburg. Member and chairman of the board of Gothenburg Handicrafts Association, board member of Gothenburg City Library, chairman of the local board of Gothenburg Half-Finished Industries. Secretary of the Technical Society in Gothenburg and member of the Gnistan Society in Gothenburg. Published: Gothenburg's Old Industries (1923), Factory and Industry in Old Gothenburg (1925), Gothenburg Industrial History in Figures 1747-1920 (1926), Eneroth & Co and its Predecessors (1930), Sugar Industry in Gothenburg 1808-1934 (1934), Carneg Porter Brewery 1812-1938 (1938), Chalmers Institute of Technology, Matrik 1829-1929 (1929), edited Chalmers Institute of Technology 1829-1929 (1929), Technical Society in Gothenburg 1882-1932 (1932), authored and edited some Odd Fellow literature (1936), published papers and essays on chemistry, meteorology, petrography, and geology. Knight of the Royal Order of the North Star, member of Odd Fellow, recipient of the Västmanland-Dalarna Society Medal. Studied at Uppsala and Chalmers University, engaged in sports. Hobbies: Genealogy, philately.
